page.title: 14THE HARWICH MARKET
page.content: THE HARWICH MARKET IS HELD EVERY FRIDAY. THE MOST COMMON FOODS BOUGHT ARE VEGETABLES, MEAT, CAKES, EGGS AND FRUIT. MOST OF THE PEOPLE USUALLY WALK TO THE MARKET EVERY WEEK BECAUSE EITHER THE FOOD IS CHEAPER OR IT IS FRESHER. THE MAIN GOODS SOLD ON THE MARKET AT DOVERCOURT ARE HARDWARE, WATCHES, PASTRY, CHEESE,WOOL, MOTOR EQUIPMENT, LINEN, HOME BREW EQUIPMENT AND FRUIT AND VEGETABLES. SOME PEOPLE THINK THAT THERE SHOULD BE A FEW MORE STALLS, ESPECIALLY A TOY STALL. ONE PERSON EVEN WANTED A STALL WHERE YOU COULD BID FOR THE ITEMS! SOME TRADERS SAY THAT THE RENT IS TOO HIGH AND NOT ENOUGH PEOPLE COME TO THE MARKET. THEY ALSO FEAR THAT THE NEW COOP SUPERMARKET BEING BUILT OPPOSITE WILL TAKE TRADE AWAY FROM THEM; MOST SHOPPERS ARE IN FAVOUR.
